issue.title: Support Logging in servant-client
issue.body:
Has there been much thought to adding logging to servant-client? In particular, I would like to log (using a custom logger) the exact request that is sent to the URL and the raw (unparsed) response that I get from the server. I was able to hack the first part of this together using a similar technique to #241. The basic idea of the code is the following:

```haskell
data LogRequest
  deriving Typeable

instance (ToHttpApiData a, HasLink sub)
      => HasLink (LogRequest :> sub) where
  type MkLink (LogRequest :> sub) = MkLink sub
  toLink _ = toLink (Proxy @sub)

instance {-# OVERLAPPABLE #-}
     (MimeUnrender ct a, ReflectMethod method, cts' ~ (ct ': cts))
  => HasClient (LogRequest :> Verb method status cts' a) where
  type Client (LogRequest :> Verb method status cts' a) =
    Client (Verb method status cts' a)
  clientWithRoute Proxy req = do
    reqHost <- asks baseUrl
    reqToRequest req reqHost >>= liftIO . Log.info ("Constructed request: " % shown)
    clientWithRoute (Proxy @(Verb method status cts' a)) req
```

There are also other instances for `Verb`. The `HasServer` class simply ignores `LogRequest` (in my application I have both clients and servers sharing the same servant spec, yay for reuse).

While this works to some extent, I don't find it very nice. It seems like a better solution would be to generalize the monad that performs the requests. Essentially make [`performRequest`](https://github.com/haskell-servant/servant/blob/25110fefe430fb7767835700252c5e07fed080ff/servant-client/src/Servant/Common/Req.hs#L227) a typeclass function and generalize the client code over any monad that supports this method. The idea seems similar to [this library](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/kawhi-0.2.1/candidate/docs/Control-Monad-Http.html).

I'm happy to implement a PR for this functionality, I'd just like to get an idea if there is a simple solution that I'm seeing, or if there a better design for the implementation.

Thanks.

comment.body: That could work: Or `class HasClient m api where`, then for `Verb` it could be `HasHttp m => HasClient m (Verb ...)`.

issue.title: Add support for user public events.
issue.body:
Implement improvement #273

This PR implements a get method as well as its associated tests for this endpoint: https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events-performed-by-a-user

Since the get repository events endpoint (https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-repository-events) was quite similar and was missing integration tests, I took advantage of this PR to write some.

I tried to respect as much as I could your coding style regarding tests, hope I managed to do that right.

Please note that I am a beginner regarding haskell, do not hesitate to let me know if I can improve something. I will not be offended and glad to fix that!

Have a nice day!

comment.body:
yeah, GITHUB_TOKEN is private and not set for non-member builds (otherwise you could expose them, by modifying `.travis.yml`); that's not an issue.

I'll look at this tomorrow

issue.title: Support Logging in servant-client
issue.body:
Has there been much thought to adding logging to servant-client? In particular, I would like to log (using a custom logger) the exact request that is sent to the URL and the raw (unparsed) response that I get from the server. I was able to hack the first part of this together using a similar technique to #241. The basic idea of the code is the following:

```haskell
data LogRequest
  deriving Typeable

instance (ToHttpApiData a, HasLink sub)
      => HasLink (LogRequest :> sub) where
  type MkLink (LogRequest :> sub) = MkLink sub
  toLink _ = toLink (Proxy @sub)

instance {-# OVERLAPPABLE #-}
     (MimeUnrender ct a, ReflectMethod method, cts' ~ (ct ': cts))
  => HasClient (LogRequest :> Verb method status cts' a) where
  type Client (LogRequest :> Verb method status cts' a) =
    Client (Verb method status cts' a)
  clientWithRoute Proxy req = do
    reqHost <- asks baseUrl
    reqToRequest req reqHost >>= liftIO . Log.info ("Constructed request: " % shown)
    clientWithRoute (Proxy @(Verb method status cts' a)) req
```

There are also other instances for `Verb`. The `HasServer` class simply ignores `LogRequest` (in my application I have both clients and servers sharing the same servant spec, yay for reuse).

While this works to some extent, I don't find it very nice. It seems like a better solution would be to generalize the monad that performs the requests. Essentially make [`performRequest`](https://github.com/haskell-servant/servant/blob/25110fefe430fb7767835700252c5e07fed080ff/servant-client/src/Servant/Common/Req.hs#L227) a typeclass function and generalize the client code over any monad that supports this method. The idea seems similar to [this library](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/kawhi-0.2.1/candidate/docs/Control-Monad-Http.html).

I'm happy to implement a PR for this functionality, I'd just like to get an idea if there is a simple solution that I'm seeing, or if there a better design for the implementation.

Thanks.

comment.body:
FWIW, I was thinking about some kind of `MonadHttp` for `servant-client` (I have one `MonadHttp` at work), but it needs a bit of work.

Side-note: we want still to allow making `http-client` specific combinators for example, if that's the client lib you'll end up using. E.g. we shouldn't make streaming impossible.
@glguy I don't remember my motivation for the first example, but IIRC it was to make the second one  easier to comprehend.

issue.title: Support Logging in servant-client
issue.body:
Has there been much thought to adding logging to servant-client? In particular, I would like to log (using a custom logger) the exact request that is sent to the URL and the raw (unparsed) response that I get from the server. I was able to hack the first part of this together using a similar technique to #241. The basic idea of the code is the following:

```haskell
data LogRequest
  deriving Typeable

instance (ToHttpApiData a, HasLink sub)
      => HasLink (LogRequest :> sub) where
  type MkLink (LogRequest :> sub) = MkLink sub
  toLink _ = toLink (Proxy @sub)

instance {-# OVERLAPPABLE #-}
     (MimeUnrender ct a, ReflectMethod method, cts' ~ (ct ': cts))
  => HasClient (LogRequest :> Verb method status cts' a) where
  type Client (LogRequest :> Verb method status cts' a) =
    Client (Verb method status cts' a)
  clientWithRoute Proxy req = do
    reqHost <- asks baseUrl
    reqToRequest req reqHost >>= liftIO . Log.info ("Constructed request: " % shown)
    clientWithRoute (Proxy @(Verb method status cts' a)) req
```

There are also other instances for `Verb`. The `HasServer` class simply ignores `LogRequest` (in my application I have both clients and servers sharing the same servant spec, yay for reuse).

While this works to some extent, I don't find it very nice. It seems like a better solution would be to generalize the monad that performs the requests. Essentially make [`performRequest`](https://github.com/haskell-servant/servant/blob/25110fefe430fb7767835700252c5e07fed080ff/servant-client/src/Servant/Common/Req.hs#L227) a typeclass function and generalize the client code over any monad that supports this method. The idea seems similar to [this library](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/kawhi-0.2.1/candidate/docs/Control-Monad-Http.html).

I'm happy to implement a PR for this functionality, I'd just like to get an idea if there is a simple solution that I'm seeing, or if there a better design for the implementation.

Thanks.

comment.body: There is [`managerModifyRequest`](http://hackage.haskell.org/package/http-client-0.5.6.1/docs/Network-HTTP-Client.html#v:managerModifyRequest) and `managerModifyResponse` which you can (ab-)use for logging.

issue.title: Clarify what's the difference between `preview`, `firstOf` and `^?`
issue.body:
`preview` and `^?` seems same (except `MonadReader`);

yet the `firstOf` is using `Leftmost`, and `preview` uses `First`. Is this intentional?

issue.title: Add some of these functions to Data.Semigroup.Foldable
issue.body:
Some `Foldable` functions are missing from `Data.Semigroup.Foldable`. See this [repo](https://github.com/arkeet/difference/blob/0f0e14f51cf1ecd7ebf2d8c52204bd91ae3b2969/src/Data/Semigroup/Difference.hs), do any of them belong there?

```haskell
foldr1m :: Foldable1 t => (a -> Maybe b -> b) -> (t a -> b)
foldr1m f = unimprove . foldMap1 (diffMaybe . f)

foldr1 :: Foldable1 t => (a -> a -> a) -> (t a -> a)
foldr1 f = unimprove . foldMap1 (\a -> Diff (f a) a)

foldl1m :: Foldable1 t => (Maybe b -> a -> b) -> (t a -> b)
foldl1m f = unimprove . getDual . foldMap1 (Dual . diffMaybe . flip f)

foldl1 :: Foldable1 t => (a -> a -> a) -> (t a -> a)
foldl1 f = unimprove . getDual . foldMap1 (\a -> Dual $ Diff (flip f a) a)

toList1 :: Foldable1 t => t a -> NonEmpty a
toList1 = foldr1m (\a -> maybe (a :| []) (a <|))
```

comment.body: @Icelandjack as that's a `base` change, you should send mail to `libraries@`.

issue.title: Make MonadDeclare more useful
issue.body:
Fixes #96.

The first commit adds instances for the standard transformers. Note: an instance is provided for `ErrorT`, which produces a deprecation warning when it's compiled.

The second commit changes the types in Schema.hs to use `MonadDeclare`. Note: this changes the type of `declareNamedSchema` which may effect users of the library who provide instances of `ToSchema`, so it may be considered a breaking change. However, I believe most reasonable implementations will continue to compile.

comment.body:
LGTM, Let's merge this when Travis is green.

Adding `State` and `RWST` (both strict and lazy), would be great too; but not necessary.

issue.title: maximum1Of and minimum1Of
issue.body:
Since we have `firstOf1`, `lastOf1` (why are they not called `head1Of`, `last1Of`?) it may be a good idea to give a `maximum1Of`, `minimum1Of` that do not return a `Maybe` using a `Getting` over `Data.Semigroup.Max`, `Data.Semigroup.Min`.

I don't have *lens* atm but they should be easy enough to write.

We could also add total versions of `foldr1Of`, `foldl1Of`.

comment.body:
I'll add a notes 

> *Note:* `firstOf` is what you are looking for, if you are searching for `headOf`.

Maybe Google will be smart enough eventually and help people, if we help it.

issue.title: Add some of these functions to Data.Semigroup.Foldable
issue.body:
Some `Foldable` functions are missing from `Data.Semigroup.Foldable`. See this [repo](https://github.com/arkeet/difference/blob/0f0e14f51cf1ecd7ebf2d8c52204bd91ae3b2969/src/Data/Semigroup/Difference.hs), do any of them belong there?

```haskell
foldr1m :: Foldable1 t => (a -> Maybe b -> b) -> (t a -> b)
foldr1m f = unimprove . foldMap1 (diffMaybe . f)

foldr1 :: Foldable1 t => (a -> a -> a) -> (t a -> a)
foldr1 f = unimprove . foldMap1 (\a -> Diff (f a) a)

foldl1m :: Foldable1 t => (Maybe b -> a -> b) -> (t a -> b)
foldl1m f = unimprove . getDual . foldMap1 (Dual . diffMaybe . flip f)

foldl1 :: Foldable1 t => (a -> a -> a) -> (t a -> a)
foldl1 f = unimprove . getDual . foldMap1 (\a -> Dual $ Diff (flip f a) a)

toList1 :: Foldable1 t => t a -> NonEmpty a
toList1 = foldr1m (\a -> maybe (a :| []) (a <|))
```

comment.body:
FWIW, `head1` and `tail1` should probably be a members of `Foldable1`; as for many tree structures (or snoc-lists) both (or other one) can be defined more efficiently. I guess it's the reasoning why `Foldable1` class is big too.

I'm neutral on `Foldable1` and `Traversable1` moving to `base`. Latter will pull in also `Data.Functor.Apply`; I'm slightly :+1: for it to eventually become superclass of `Applicative`, but it would be great to figure out some convenience mechanism so the migration would be as simple as possible (there're plenty of `Applicative`s). I guess that's the reason why it's not proposed, nobody yet knows the good ending to the story.

issue.title: "thread blocked indefinitely in an STM transaction"
issue.body:
I've noticed that from time to time cabal seems to fail with

```
...
Building hspec-core-2.4.3 (lib)...
Configuring hspec-2.4.3 (lib)...
Building hspec-2.4.3 (lib)...
thread blocked indefinitely in an STM transaction
```

which is quite annoying with CI jobs.

Just now, @alexbiehl ran into the very same issue on Travis: https://travis-ci.org/haskell/haddock/jobs/225512194#L377

and I was able to reproduce this locally as well (and quite reliably). In order to be able to reproduce it, `~/.cabal/store` should be empty, as well as the source-tarball cache in `~/.cabal/packages/hackage.haskell.org/*/*/*`, as this seems to occur only when cabal needs to download source-tarballs during `new-build`.

(Moreover, a less important observation: this occurs with both `--http-transport=curl` and `--http-transport=http-plain`)

comment.body: Uh. That interesting, what's then causing the stm exceptions (some unfortunate timing of events is causing deadlock-like situation?)

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
+module GitHub.EventsSpec where
+
+import Data.Either        (isRight)
+import Data.String        (fromString)
+import System.Environment (lookupEnv)
+import Test.Hspec         (Spec, describe, it, shouldSatisfy,
+                           pendingWith)
+
+import qualified GitHub
+import GitHub.Data (Auth(..))
+
+fromRightS :: Show a => Either a b -> b
+fromRightS (Left xs) = error $ "Should be Right" ++ show xs
+fromRightS (Right xs) = xs
+
+withAuth :: (Auth -> IO ()) -> IO ()
+withAuth action = do
+  mtoken <- lookupEnv "GITHUB_TOKEN"
+  case mtoken of
+    Nothing    -> pendingWith "no GITHUB_TOKEN"
+    Just token -> action (OAuth $ fromString token)
+
+spec :: Spec
+spec = do
+  describe "repositoryEventsR" $ do
+    it "returns non empty list of events" $ shouldSucceed $
+      GitHub.repositoryEventsR "phadej" "github" 1
+  describe "userEventsR" $ do
+    it "returns non empty list of events" $ shouldSucceed $ GitHub.userEventsR "phadej" 1 
+  where shouldSucceed f = withAuth $ \auth -> do
comment.body: Note to self: refactor this when merged (quicker to do myself, than try to explain what I want).

pull_request.title: Add support for user public events.
pull_request.body:
Implement improvement #273

This PR implements a get method as well as its associated tests for this endpoint: https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events-performed-by-a-user

Since the get repository events endpoint (https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-repository-events) was quite similar and was missing integration tests, I took advantage of this PR to write some.

I tried to respect as much as I could your coding style regarding tests, hope I managed to do that right.

Please note that I am a beginner regarding haskell, do not hesitate to let me know if I can improve something. I will not be offended and glad to fix that!

Have a nice day!

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
+module GitHub.EventsSpec where
+
+import Data.Either        (isRight)
+import Data.String        (fromString)
+import System.Environment (lookupEnv)
+import Test.Hspec         (Spec, describe, it, shouldSatisfy,
+                           pendingWith)
+
+import qualified GitHub
+import GitHub.Data (Auth(..))
+
+fromRightS :: Show a => Either a b -> b
+fromRightS (Left xs) = error $ "Should be Right" ++ show xs
+fromRightS (Right xs) = xs
+
+withAuth :: (Auth -> IO ()) -> IO ()
+withAuth action = do
+  mtoken <- lookupEnv "GITHUB_TOKEN"
+  case mtoken of
+    Nothing    -> pendingWith "no GITHUB_TOKEN"
+    Just token -> action (OAuth $ fromString token)
+
+spec :: Spec
+spec = do
+  describe "repositoryEventsR" $ do
+    it "returns non empty list of events" $ shouldSucceed $
+      GitHub.repositoryEventsR "phadej" "github" 1
+  describe "userEventsR" $ do
+    it "returns non empty list of events" $ shouldSucceed $ GitHub.userEventsR "phadej" 1 
+  where shouldSucceed f = withAuth $ \auth -> do
+          cs <- GitHub.executeRequest auth $ f
+          cs `shouldSatisfy` isRight
+          length (fromRightS cs) `shouldSatisfy` (> 1)
comment.body:
use

```
import Prelude ()
import Prelude.Compat
```

to get correct (polymorphic) `length`.

issue.title: Add SurelyIxed class
issue.body:
This refines `Ixed` for total indexing, such as for representable
functors.

Implements #694

comment.body:
I use similar class at work (I call it `Att` :P). It's useful for `a -> b` instance. Also I have a date `TotalMap k v { tmDef :: v, tmMap :: Map k v }`, where `Att` is useful.

I don't like `Att` neither `SurelyIxed` names. something short yet descriptive would be great.

issue.title: maximum1Of and minimum1Of
issue.body:
Since we have `firstOf1`, `lastOf1` (why are they not called `head1Of`, `last1Of`?) it may be a good idea to give a `maximum1Of`, `minimum1Of` that do not return a `Maybe` using a `Getting` over `Data.Semigroup.Max`, `Data.Semigroup.Min`.

I don't have *lens* atm but they should be easy enough to write.

We could also add total versions of `foldr1Of`, `foldl1Of`.

comment.body:
I actually think to rename them to `first1Of`; I agree that `1` should be before `Of`. `first` because we already have `firstOf`.

I'll add do the name change and add `maximum1Of` and `minimum1Of`, as well as `traverse1Of`. I @ekmett doesn't object.
